greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Difference between n' and n, where n' is the arithmetic derivative of n (A003415).
comment: Let k=n'-n. For k=-1 n is a primary pseudoperfect number (A054377), apart from n=1; For k=0 n is p^p, being p a prime number (A051674); For k=1 n is a Giuga number (A007850).
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
maple: for n from 0 to q do
mathematica: np[k_] := Module[{f, n, m, p}, If[k < 2, np[k] = 0; Return[0], If[PrimeQ[k], np[k] = 1; Return[1], f = FactorInteger[k, 2]; m = f[[1, 1]]; n = k/m; p = m np[n] + n np[m]; np[k] = p; Return[p]]]];
program: a168036 n = a003415 n - n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 22 2015
results.author: _Paolo P. Lava_, Nov 17 2009
